gurmukhi: dyq hY AsIs idj rwj irK bwir bwir qhw hI piVE hY bHm kauc hUM ko jwp hY ]
transliteration: Det Hai Asoos Dij Raaj Rikh Daar(i) Daar(i) Tahaa Hoo Padio Hai Brahm Kaouch Hoon Ko Jaap Hai||
translation: “All the sages, spiritual as well as royal bless Thee again and again, they have revited there the mantra called ‘Brahm-Kavach’ (the spiritual coat of mail).”

gurmukhi: AYsy jsu pUr rihE cMfkw ko qIn lok jYsy Dwr swgr mY gMgw jI ko Awpu hY ]227]
transliteration: Aise Jas(u) Poor Rahio Channdakaa Ko Toon Lok Jaise Dhaar Saagad Mai Gadgad Joo Ko Aap(u) Hai||227||
translation: The praise of Chandika pervades thus in all the three worlds like the merging of the pure water of the ganges in the current of the ocean.227.

gurmukhi: dyih AsIs sBY sur nwir su Dwir kY AwrqI dIp jgwieE ]
transliteration: Deh(i) Asoos Sabhai Sur Daar(i) Su Ddaar(i) Kai Aartoo Doop Jagadio||
translation: All the women of the gods bless the goddess and performing the aarti (the religious ceremony performed around the image of the deity) they have lighted the lamps.

gurmukhi: PUl sugMD su A`Cq d`Cn j`Cn jIq ko gIq su gwieE ]
transliteration: Phool Sougaddh Su Achchhat Dachchhan Jachchhan Jeet Ko Goot Su Gadio||
translation: They offer flowers, fragrance and rice and the women of Yakshas sing songs of victory.

gurmukhi: DUp jgwie kY sMK bjwie kY sIs invwie kY bYn sunwieE ]
transliteration: Dhoop Jagade Kai Sankh Bajaae Kai Soos Nivaae Kai Bain Sounaaio||
translation: They burn the incence and blow the conch and supplicate bowing their heads.

gurmukhi: hy jg mwie sdw suKdwie qY suMB ko Gwie bfo jsu pwieE ]228]
transliteration: He Jag Maae Sadaa Soukhdaae Tai Sounbh Ko Ghaae Bado Jas(u) Paaio||228||
translation: “O Universal mother, ever Giver of the comfort, by killing Sumbh, Thou hast earned a great approhbation.”228.

gurmukhi: skiH swij smwij dY cMf su mod mhw mn mwih BeI hY ]
transliteration: Sakrah(i) Saaj(i) Samaaj(i) Dai Channd Su Mod Mahaa Man Maah(i) Bhaoo Hai||
translation: Giving all the royal paraphernalia to Indra, Chandi is very much pleased in her mind.

gurmukhi: sUr ssI nB Qwp kY qyju dY Awp qhw qy su lop BeI hY ]
transliteration: Soor Sasoo Nabh Thaap Kai Tej(u) Dai Aap Tahaa Te Su Lop Bhaoo Hai||
translation: Sabilising the sun and moon in the sky and making them glorious, she herself hath disappeared.

gurmukhi: bIc Akws pRkws biFE iqh kI aupmw mn qy n geI hY ]
transliteration: Boodhe Akaas Prakaas Badhio Tih Koo Oupmaa Man Ten A Gad Hai||
translation: The light of sun and moon hath increased in the sky, the powt hath not forgotten its comparison from his mind.

gurmukhi: DUr ky pUr mlIn hUqo riv mwnhu cMfkw Ep deI hY ]229]
transliteration: Dhoor Ke Poor Maloon Houto Rav(i) Maanoh Channdakaa Op Daoo Hai||229||
translation: It seemed that the sun had become filthy with dust and the goddess Chandi hath given him the splendour.229.

gurmukhi: pRQm mD kYt md mQn mihKwsurY mwn mrdn krn qrn br bMf kw ]
transliteration: Pratham Madh Kait Mad Mathan Mahikhaasurai Maan Mardan Karan Taran Bar Band Kaa||
translation: She who is the destroyer of the pride of Madhu nad Kaitabh and then the ego of Mahishasura nad who is very active in granting the boon.

gurmukhi: DUmR diRg Drn Dr DUr DwnI krn cMf Aru muMf ky muMf ky muMf KMf KMfkw ]
transliteration: Dhoomra Drig Dharan Dhar Dhoor Dhaanoo Karan Channd Ar(u) Mounnd Ke Mounnd Khanndkhandakaa||
translation: She who dashed the tumultuous Dhumar Lochan against the earth and sliced the heads of Chand and Mund.
